H0.text: The depth of the soil is the most important information to record for Marta and Rogerâ€™s investigation comparing how long two different types of seeds take to sprout when they plant both in similar pots, place them in a sunny window, and water them daily.

H1.text: The temperature of the water is the most important information to record if Marta and Roger want to conduct their investigation correctly when comparing how long it takes two different types of seeds to sprout, planting both types in similar pots, placing them in a sunny window, and watering them daily.

H2.text: The number of days until the seeds sprout is the most important information for Marta and Roger to record when comparing the sprouting times of two different types of seeds planted in similar pots, placed in a sunny window, and watered daily.

H3.text: The size of pot used for growing the seeds is the most important information Marta and Roger should record when comparing how long two different types of seeds take to sprout, given they plant both types in similar pots, place them in a sunny window, and water them daily.

A4.text: Disturbance of soil can result in vigorous plant growth by exposing seeds already in the soil to changes in environmental factors where germination may have previously been inhibited by depth of the seeds or soil that was too compact.

A5.text: Seeds that require the cold of winter are inhibited from germinating until they take in water in the fall and experience cooler temperatures.

A6.text: mung bean seeds germinating over 10 days

A7.text: The most important external factors include right temperature, water, oxygen or air and sometimes light or darkness.

A8.text: Suboptimal temperatures lead to lower success rates and longer germination periods.
